image.altText: an aerial photo of a gold mine.

props.synopsis: A Canadian gold miner has been fined $160,000 for conducting illegal exploration drilling at an Aboriginal sacred site, after the company's own press release tipped authorities off to the damage.

title.children: Judge fines gold mining company for 'mercenary' drilling at sacred site

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie, sitting at a desk inside an office with a view of Darwin Harbour.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption, Michael Riches, has resigned from his role, the NT chief minister has announced.

title.children: NT ICAC commissioner Michael Riches resigns suddenly

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman wearing a red blazer and black top, delivering a speech in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory opposition leader has delivered her first budget reply speech, claiming the jurisdiction's future will be "bleak" under the government's prison-focused crime approach.

title.children: Opposition calls NT budget 'bleak' with 'delusional' solutions to crime

image.altText: A woman with long hair talks to waiting media outside a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Danielle Wilson is suing the Civil Aviation Safety Authority over her husband's death in a remote chopper crash. CASA blames the helicopter operator, which it says "did precisely what CASA said they couldn't".

title.children: Widow of Netflix star 'pleased' with court ruling after fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: An aerial view of Larrimah in the Northern Territory

props.synopsis: Indigenous people in the remote community of Jilkminggan fear their springs and creeks will be degraded as a new water licence allows for an 800-hectare irrigated cotton plantation.

title.children: Controversial water licence approved for cotton and hay around Larrimah

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: Several Legal Aid NT board members, including its chair, have resigned following the Attorney-General's "captain's pick" appointment to head up the embattled organisation.

title.children: NT government's 'captain's pick' for legal agency sparks multiple resignations

image.altText: Hands grasping a cyclone wire fence.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's tough new bail laws have seen a youth "success story", charged with a machete robbery after his rehabilitation program was defunded, sent back to jail.

title.children: Youth rehab 'success story' denied bail under NT's tough new laws

image.altText: Large packets of a light brown powdery substance with red labels on top, stacked on a table.

props.synopsis: Kava smuggling into the Northern Territory's remote Indigenous communities is on the rise, with local leaders fearing the black market price of the drink is draining family finances and fuelling social problems.

title.children: Smuggled kava is smashing family finances in the remote NT, leaders say

image.altText: Rows of antennas seen at sunset.

props.synopsis: Canada's decision to turn to Australia for help in beefing up its defence of the Arctic has raised eyebrows in the defence industry.

title.children: Canada has turned to Australia as its relationship with the US crumbles

image.altText: Large packets of a light brown powdery substance with red labels on top, stacked on a table.

props.synopsis: Kava smuggling into the Northern Territory's remote Indigenous communities is on the rise, with local leaders fearing the black market price of the drink is draining family finances and fuelling social problems.

title.children: Smuggled kava is smashing family finances in the remote NT, leaders say

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Military figures in Ukraine believe a young Australian was killed in the contested Kharkiv region but his remains have not been located.

title.children: Australian tradie who wanted to 'push himself' in Ukraine feared dead

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: Annual wage growth lifted to 3.4 per cent in the March quarter, from 3.2 per cent in December. It is the first annual increase in wage growth since the June quarter last year.

title.children: Annual wage growth ticks up to 3.4 per cent in March quarter

image.altText: A sketch of a greay-bearded man wearing a button-up shirt cupping his face with one hand.

props.synopsis: Peter Sullivan, who spent 38 years, seven months and 21 days in custody, is thought to be the victim of England's longest miscarriage of justice involving a living prisoner.

title.children: Man freed by new DNA evidence after 38 years in prison for murder

image.altText: close up image of ahmed al-sharaa, president of syria

props.synopsis: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa remains a listed terrorist according to the US government, but Donald Trump is determined to restore "normal relations" with the Syrian government.

title.children: Syria's president is still a listed terrorist and Trump just met him. Here's why

image.altText: Child overlooking a dam next to green hills.

props.synopsis: In a sharp escalation, New Delhi has suspended its water-sharing treaty with Pakistan and accelerated the construction of four dams — moves that legal experts warn could weaponise water in an already volatile region.

title.children: Why a historic water treaty is a flashpoint between India and Pakistan

image.altText: A woman and a man standing on a stage raise each other's hands

props.synopsis: As the final votes are tallied, here's how the results could shape the future of the Duterte and Marcos clans in the Philippines.

title.children: 'House of Marcos potentially sinking': Fallout from Philippine midterms

image.altText: An Air Canada plane parked on the tarmac, taken on an unspecified date.

props.synopsis: The 2019 Vancouver to Sydney flight experienced significant turbulence at 36,000 feet. It landed in Honlulu, Hawaii, with 37 injuries recorded, nine of which were major.

title.children: Passengers who claimed injuries from turbulence lose High Court appeal

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: Australian shares just scraped into positive territory by the day's close on Wednesday. Bureau of Statistics data showed wage growth picked up in the March quarter. ASIC takes action against Macquarie for the fourth time in 12 months.

title.children: ASX closes higher, Macquarie shares fall on ASIC lawsuit — as it happened

image.altText: A Macquarie sign.

props.synopsis: Corporate regulator ASIC launches its fourth action against Macquarie in just over a year, alleging its broking arm misreported millions of short sales to the market operator over a 14-year period.

title.children: Macquarie sued for allegedly misreporting millions of short sales

image.altText: rocket in vertical position at night

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast company's orbital rocket could enter space from a north Queensland launch pad by the end of the week. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Australia's first home-grown rocket counts down to cow paddock launch

image.altText: lyle and erik menedez sit in a beverly hills courtroom in 1990 wearing black suits

props.synopsis: Erik and Lyle Menendez will have a new shot at freedom after a judge reduced the brothers' sentences from life without parole to 50 years to life.

title.children: Judge reduces Menendez brothers' murder sentences, now eligible for parole

image.altText: Girl looking sad at playground

props.synopsis: The national children's commissioner wants a cabinet minister for children and is calling on governments to "act on evidence" from child protection reports. This comes after the ABC exposed that children were being sexually exploited in the $2 billion residential care system.

title.children: 'Shameful': Demand for action after residential care exploitation revelations

image.altText: Hikers bushwalking in the Australian landscape.

props.synopsis: Some NSW national park campgrounds could cost six times more per night if an attempt to standardise fees is adopted, and nature enthusiasts are concerned it will make camping unaffordable for many.

title.children: National parks plan to standardise fees in NSW amid rise in 'ghost camping'

image.altText: Robert De Niro holding up the Palme d'Or with Leonardo DiCaprio clapping beside him, both dressed in tuxes

props.synopsis: As he was presented with the Cannes Film Festival's highest honour, veteran actor Robert De Niro denounced US President Donald Trump while referencing Mr Trump's recent announcement of 100 per cent tariffs on movies "produced in foreign lands".

title.children: Robert De Niro slams Donald Trump in acceptance speech at Cannes

image.altText: A graphic of a man charging an EV on a power pole with a colour treatment drawing attention

props.synopsis: A lack of charging infrastructure across the country is often cited as a barrier to the transition to electric vehicles. But soon, EV charging could be a simple as finding a car park.

title.children: Thousands of power poles make the potential for EV charging limitless

image.altText: Men walk into war-torn hospital

props.synopsis: Israel has launched air strikes at two hospitals in Gaza, reportedly attempting to assassinate Hamas chief.

title.children: Israel launches deadly strikes on Gaza hospitals, targeting Hamas chief Sinwar

image.altText: Sam Kerr of Australia greets fans, smiling and engaging

props.synopsis: Injured Matildas captain Sam Kerr remains a "camp by camp" proposition and may decide to complete full pre-season with Chelsea before returning to the international scene.

title.children: Matildas squad named, no certainty on Sam Kerr's return

image.altText: A woman with a social media award smiling for the camera

props.synopsis: Dr Kristyn Sommer says it didn't feel right to post about her children anymore despite having more than half a million followers on TikTok and Instagram.

title.children: Kristyn's travel video with her kids had 18 million views. She chose to delete it

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication playing out in Australian pharmacies

image.altText: Soldiers dressed in fatigues walk across the snow covered ground of a forest.

props.synopsis: Finland has long been a nation of preppers, thanks in part to its close proximity to Russia. So could its self-sufficiency be a role model for other nations, including Australia?

title.children: If disaster strikes Finland, an 'elite' group of civilians will be ready

image.altText: A river channel cutting through greenery, sun reflecting on the water.

props.synopsis: Just add water to the Channel Country and watch it spring to life. It's a silver lining of recent devastating flooding in the outback.

title.children: Floods transform Channel Country into pelican paradise

image.altText: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii being treated by medical staff after suffering a concussion.

props.synopsis: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii will undergo surgery after it was revealed he sustained a fractured jaw during the Waratahs' loss to the Reds last Friday night.

title.children: Wallabies star Suaalii suffers fractured jaw ahead of Lions series

image.altText: A sketch of Casandra Ventura holding up one hand in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs's former girlfriend gives evidence at his criminal trial, telling jurors she felt she had no choice but to participate in the "freak-off" sex parties central to the case.

title.children: Singer Cassie questioned about sex 'freak-offs' at Diddy's trial

image.altText: A man in hand-cuffs is escorted by two police officers along a road.

props.synopsis: A case where a group of men allegedly impersonated police to break into a Mawson home appears before the ACT Magistrates Court, with police saying they believe the victim was mistakenly targeted.

title.children: Pair allegedly impersonated police in Canberra home invasion

image.altText: Trish and Bernie pictured in a house together

props.synopsis: Two women abused by a paedophile priest in the 1970s are pursuing the Catholic Church for compensation, but a High Court decision has put their case in jeopardy.

title.children: Sisters were so haunted by historical abuse they jammed their doors closed
